compound.name: Changing Modbus Settings
compound.description:
This sketch uses hardware serial to connect with GroPoint Profile and change the default modbus settings from 19200 8E1 to 9600 8N1.

You will probably need to use this example to prepare a new sensor to communicate with most Arduino streams that only support 8N1.

NOTE GroPoint Profile sensor default Modbus communication settings are 19200 Baud, 8 Bits, Even Parity, one Stop Bit (8-E-1); see p35 of manual. Neither SoftwareSerial, AltSoftSerial, nor NeoSoftwareSerial will support either even or odd parity!

8-N-1 (no parity) is the most common configuration for serial communications.

This sketch depends on the GropointModbus library and also loosly on the SensorModbusMaster library via it's example sketch: SensorModbusMaster/examples/readWriteRegister/readWriteRegister.ino

PlatformIO Configuration

1; PlatformIO Project Configuration File
2;
3; Build options: build flags, source filter
4; Upload options: custom upload port, speed and extra flags
5; Library options: dependencies, extra library storages
6; Advanced options: extra scripting
7;
8; Please visit documentation for the other options and examples
9; http://docs.platformio.org/page/projectconf.html
10
11[platformio]
12description = Changing a setting and reading data from a modbus sensor
13
14[env:mayfly]
15monitor_speed = 115200
16board = mayfly
17platform = atmelavr
18framework = arduino
19lib_deps =
20 envirodiy/SensorModbusMaster
21 envirodiy/GroPointModbus
22 https://github.com/PaulStoffregen/AltSoftSerial.git

The Complete Code

1/** =========================================================================
2 * @example{lineno} ChangeModbusSettings.ino
3 * @author Anthony Aufdenkampe
4 * @license This example is published under the BSD-3 license.
5 *
6 * @brief This sketch uses hardware serial to connect with GroPoint Profile and change
7 * default modbus settings from 19200 8E1 to 9600 8N1.
8 *
9 * @note GroPoint Profile sensor default Modbus communication settings are 19200 Baud, 8
10 * Bits, Even Parity, one Stop Bit (8-E-1). See p35 of manual. 8-N-1 (no parity) is the
11 * most common configuration for serial communications.
12 *
13 * @warning Neither SoftwareSerial, AltSoftSerial, nor NeoSoftwareSerial will support
14 * either even or odd parity!
15 *
16 * This sketch depends on the GropointModbus library and also loosly on the
17 * SensorModbusMaster library via it's example sketch:
18 * SensorModbusMaster/examples/readWriteRegister/readWriteRegister.ino
19 * ======================================================================= */
20
21// ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
22// Include the base required libraries
23// ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
24#include <Arduino.h>
25#include <GroPointModbus.h>
26
27// Turn on debugging outputs (i.e. raw Modbus requests & responsds)
28// by uncommenting next line (i.e. `#define DEBUG`)
29// #define DEBUG
30
31// ==========================================================================
32// Sensor Settings
33// ==========================================================================
34// Define the sensor type
35gropointModel model = GPLP8; // The sensor model number
36
37// Define the sensor's modbus address, or SlaveID
38// NOTE: The GroPoint User Manual presents SlaveID and registers as decimal
39// integers, whereas EnviroDIY and most other modbus systems present it in
40// hexadecimal form. Use an online "HEX to DEC Converter".
41byte defaultModbusAddress = 0x01; // GroPoint ships sensors with a default ID of 0x01.
42byte newModbusAddress = 0x19; // Hex 0x19 = Decimal 25 is unique in ModularSensors.
43
44// The Modbus baud rate the sensor uses
45int32_t defaultModbusBaud = 19200; // GroPoint default baud rate is 19200.
46int32_t newModbusBaud = 9600; // 9600 is a safer baud rate to use
47
48// The Modbus parity the sensor uses
49// see
50// https://www.arduino.cc/reference/en/language/functions/communication/serial/begin/
51// for allowable configurations.
52// 8-E-1 is GroPoint default parity.
53// 8-N-1 is the recommended parity because it is more widely supported and the only
54// allowable parity for AltSoftSerial, NeoSWSerial, & SoftwareSerial and several other
55// board serial libraries.
56#if defined(ESP8266)
57#include <SoftwareSerial.h>
58uint8_t defaultModbusParity = SWSERIAL_8E1;
59uint8_t newModbusParity = SWSERIAL_8N1;
60String newModbusParity_str = "None";
61// NOTE: See
62// https://github.com/plerup/espsoftwareserial/blob/40038df/src/SoftwareSerial.h#L120-L160
63// for a list of data/parity/stop bit configurations that apply to the ESP8266's
64// implementation of SoftwareSerial
65#else
66uint8_t defaultModbusParity = SERIAL_8E1;
67uint8_t newModbusParity = SERIAL_8N1;
68String newModbusParity_str = "None";
69// NOTE: See
70// https://github.com/arduino/ArduinoCore-avr/blob/321fca0bac806bdd36af8afbc13587f4b67eb5f1/cores/arduino/HardwareSerial.h#L68-L91
71// for a list of data/parity/stop bit configurations that apply to AVR and most other
72// HardwareSerial instances.
73#endif
74
75// Sensor Timing. Edit these to explore!
76#define WARM_UP_TIME 350 // milliseconds for sensor to respond to commands.
77// GroPoint Profile User Manual page 7:
78// The time from application of power to the SDI-12 power bus until the
79// sensor is ready to receive a command is approximately 350 ms.
80
81#define STABILIZATION_TIME 100 // milliseconds for readings to stablize.
82
83#define MEASUREMENT_TIME 200 // milliseconds to complete a measurement.
84// GroPoint Profile User Manual page 39:
85// Moisture measurements take approximately 200 ms per segment.
86// Temperature measurements take approximately 200 ms per sensor.
87
88
89// ==========================================================================
90// Data Logging Options
91// ==========================================================================
92const int32_t serialBaud = 115200; // Baud rate for serial monitor
93
94// Define pin number variables
95const int sensorPwrPin = 10; // The pin sending power to the sensor
96const int adapterPwrPin = 22; // The pin sending power to the RS485 adapter
97const int DEREPin = -1; // The pin controlling Recieve Enable and Driver Enable
98 // on the RS485 adapter, if applicable (else, -1)
99 // Setting HIGH enables the driver (arduino) to send text
100 // Setting LOW enables the receiver (sensor) to send text
101
102// Construct a Serial object for Modbus
103#if defined(ARDUINO_AVR_UNO) || defined(ARDUINO_AVR_FEATHER328P)
104// The Uno only has 1 hardware serial port, which is dedicated to comunication with the
105// computer. If using an Uno, you will be restricted to using AltSofSerial or
106// SoftwareSerial
107#include <SoftwareSerial.h>
108const int SSRxPin = 10; // Receive pin for software serial (Rx on RS485 adapter)
109const int SSTxPin = 11; // Send pin for software serial (Tx on RS485 adapter)
110#pragma message("Using Software Serial for the Uno on pins 10 and 11")
111SoftwareSerial modbusSerial(SSRxPin, SSTxPin);
112// AltSoftSerial modbusSerial;
113#elif defined(ESP8266)
114#pragma message("Using Software Serial for the ESP8266")
115SoftwareSerial modbusSerial;
116#elif defined(NRF52832_FEATHER) || defined(ARDUINO_NRF52840_FEATHER)
117#pragma message("Using TinyUSB for the NRF52")
118#include <Adafruit_TinyUSB.h>
119HardwareSerial& modbusSerial = Serial1;
120#elif !defined(NO_GLOBAL_SERIAL1) && !defined(STM32_CORE_VERSION)
121// This is just a assigning another name to the same port, for convienence
122// Unless it is unavailable, always prefer hardware serial.
123#pragma message("Using HarwareSerial / Serial1")
124HardwareSerial& modbusSerial = Serial1;
125#else
126// This is just a assigning another name to the same port, for convienence
127// Unless it is unavailable, always prefer hardware serial.
128#pragma message("Using HarwareSerial / Serial")
129HardwareSerial& modbusSerial = Serial;
130#endif
131
132// Construct the gropoint sensor instance
133gropoint sensor;
134bool success;
135
136// Construct a SensorModbusMaster class instance, from
137// https://github.com/EnviroDIY/SensorModbusMaster
138modbusMaster modbus;
139
140
141// ==========================================================================
142// Working Functions
143// ==========================================================================
144// A function for pretty-printing the Modbuss Address in Hexadecimal notation,
145// from ModularSensors `sensorLocation()`
146String prettyprintAddressHex(byte _modbusAddress) {
147 String addressHex = F("0x");
148 if (_modbusAddress < 0x10) addressHex += "0";
149 addressHex += String(_modbusAddress, HEX);
150 return addressHex;
151}
152
153// ==========================================================================
154// Arduino Setup Function
155// ==========================================================================
156void setup() {
157 // Setup power pins
158 if (sensorPwrPin >= 0) {
159 pinMode(sensorPwrPin, OUTPUT);
160 digitalWrite(sensorPwrPin, HIGH);
161 }
162 if (adapterPwrPin >= 0) {
163 pinMode(adapterPwrPin, OUTPUT);
164 digitalWrite(adapterPwrPin, HIGH);
165 }
166 if (DEREPin >= 0) { pinMode(DEREPin, OUTPUT); }
167
168 // Turn on the "main" serial port for debugging via USB Serial Monitor
169 Serial.begin(serialBaud);
170
171 // Turn on your modbus serial port
172#if defined(ARDUINO_AVR_UNO) || defined(ARDUINO_AVR_FEATHER328P) || \
173 defined(ARDUINO_SAM_DUE) || not defined(SERIAL_8E1)
174 Serial.println(F("THIS DEVICE CANNOT BE USED TO CHANGE THE DEFAULT SERIAL PARITY"));
175 return;
176 // NOTE: The AVR implementation of SoftwareSerial only supports 8N1
177 // The hardware serial implementation of the Due also only supports 8N1
178#elif defined(ESP8266)
179 const int SSRxPin = 13; // Receive pin for software serial (Rx on RS485 adapter)
180 const int SSTxPin = 14; // Send pin for software serial (Tx on RS485 adapter)
181 modbusSerial.begin(defaultModbusBaud, defaultModbusParity, SSRxPin, SSTxPin, false);
182#else
183 // Setup your modbus hardware serial port
184 modbusSerial.begin(defaultModbusBaud, defaultModbusParity);
185#endif
186
187 // Setup the sensor instance
188 sensor.begin(model, defaultModbusAddress, &modbusSerial, DEREPin);
189
190// Turn on debugging
191#ifdef DEBUG
192 sensor.setDebugStream(&Serial);
193#endif
194
195 // Start up note
196 Serial.println(F("\nChange Modbus Settings for GroPoint Profile sensors "));
197
198 // Allow the sensor and converter to warm up
199 Serial.println(F("Waiting for sensor and adapter to be ready."));
200 Serial.print(F(" Warm up time (ms): "));
201 Serial.println(WARM_UP_TIME);
202 Serial.println();
203 delay(WARM_UP_TIME);
204
205 // Confirm Modbus Address
206 Serial.println(F("Default sensor modbus address:"));
207 Serial.print(F(" Decimal: "));
208 Serial.print(defaultModbusAddress, DEC);
209 Serial.print(F(", Hexidecimal: "));
210 Serial.println(prettyprintAddressHex(defaultModbusAddress));
211 Serial.println();
212
213 // Read Sensor Modbus Address
214 Serial.println(F("Get sensor modbus address."));
215 byte id = sensor.getSensorAddress();
216 Serial.print(F(" Decimal: "));
217 Serial.print(id, DEC);
218 Serial.print(F(", Hexidecimal: "));
219 Serial.println(prettyprintAddressHex(id));
220 Serial.println();
221
222 // Get Sensor Modbus Baud
223 Serial.println(F("Get sensor modbus baud setting."));
224 int16_t sensorBaud = sensor.getSensorBaud();
225 Serial.print(F(" Baud: "));
226 Serial.println(sensorBaud);
227 Serial.println(F(" Change is effective immediately, so change last."));
228 Serial.println();
229
230 // Get Sensor Modbus Parity
231 Serial.println(F("Get sensor modbus parity setting."));
232 String sensorParity = sensor.getSensorParity();
233 Serial.print(F(" Parity: "));
234 Serial.println(sensorParity);
235 Serial.println();
236
237 // Delay to give time to restart with serial monitor turned on.
238 Serial.println(F("Resetting Modbus Serial Settings."));
239 Serial.println(F(" Additional 5s delay time to turn on serial monitor.\n"));
240 delay(5000);
241
242 // Set sensor modbus baud
243 Serial.print(F("Set sensor modbus baud to "));
244 Serial.println(newModbusBaud);
245 success = sensor.setSensorBaud(newModbusBaud);
246 if (success) {
247 Serial.println(" Success! New baud will take effect once sensor is "
248 "power cycled.");
249 } else
250 Serial.println(F(" Baud reset failed!"));
251 Serial.println();
252
253 // Set sensor modbus parity
254 Serial.print(F("Set sensor modbus parity to "));
255 Serial.println(newModbusParity_str);
256 success = sensor.setSensorParity(newModbusParity_str);
257 if (success) {
258 Serial.println(
259 " Success! New parity will take effect once sensor is power cycled.");
260 } else
261 Serial.println(F(" Parity reset failed!"));
262 Serial.println();
263
264 // Set sensor modbus address
265 Serial.print(F("Set sensor modbus address to "));
266 Serial.println(prettyprintAddressHex(newModbusAddress));
267 success = sensor.setSensorAddress(newModbusAddress);
268 if (success) {
269 Serial.println(
270 F(" Success! New modbus address will take effect immediately."));
271 } else
272 Serial.println(F(" Address reset failed!"));
273 Serial.println(F("\n"));
274
275 Serial.println(F("Upload a sketch with the new Modbus settings "));
276 Serial.println(F("to reestablish communications with the sensor."));
277}
278
279// ==========================================================================
280// Arduino Loop Function
281// ==========================================================================
282void loop() {
283 // Empty loop function
284}
breadcrumb: Examples using the GroPoint Modbus Library
